trans-unit.source: Monitor Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Ambari API | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Monitor Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Ambari API | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use the Apache Ambari APIs for provisioning, managing, and monitoring Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use the Apache Ambari APIs for provisioning, managing, and monitoring Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Intuitive operator tools and APIs hide the complexity of Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: Intuitive operator tools and APIs hide the complexity of Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: Monitor Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Ambari API
trans-unit.target: Monitor Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using the Ambari API

trans-unit.source: Learn how to monitor HDInsight clusters versions 3.1 and 2.1 by using Ambari APIs.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to monitor HDInsight clusters versions 3.1 and 2.1 by using Ambari APIs.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The information in this article is primarily for Windows-based HDInsight clusters, which provide a read-only version of the Ambari REST API.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The information in this article is primarily for Windows-based HDInsight clusters, which provide a read-only version of the Ambari REST API.

trans-unit.source: For Linux-based clusters, see [Manage Hadoop clusters using Ambari](hdinsight-hadoop-manage-ambari.md).
trans-unit.target: For Linux-based clusters, see [Manage Hadoop clusters using Ambari](hdinsight-hadoop-manage-ambari.md).

trans-unit.source: [Apache Ambari][ambari-home] is used for provisioning, managing, and monitoring Apache Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: [Apache Ambari][ambari-home] is used for provisioning, managing, and monitoring Apache Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: It includes an intuitive collection of operator tools and a robust set of APIs that hide the complexity of Hadoop, simplifying the operation of clusters.
trans-unit.target: It includes an intuitive collection of operator tools and a robust set of APIs that hide the complexity of Hadoop, simplifying the operation of clusters.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the APIs, see [Ambari API Reference][ambari-api-reference].
trans-unit.target: For more information about the APIs, see [Ambari API Reference][ambari-api-reference].

trans-unit.source: HDInsight currently supports only the Ambari monitoring feature.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight currently supports only the Ambari monitoring feature.

trans-unit.source: Ambari API 1.0 is supported by HDInsight version 3.0 and 2.1 clusters.
trans-unit.target: Ambari API 1.0 is supported by HDInsight version 3.0 and 2.1 clusters.

trans-unit.source: This article covers accessing Ambari APIs on HDInsight version 3.1 and 2.1 clusters.
trans-unit.target: This article covers accessing Ambari APIs on HDInsight version 3.1 and 2.1 clusters.

trans-unit.source: The key difference between the two is that some of the components have changed with the introduction of new capabilities (such as the Job History Server).
trans-unit.target: The key difference between the two is that some of the components have changed with the introduction of new capabilities (such as the Job History Server).

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: To install it, see [cURL Releases and Downloads][curl-download].
trans-unit.target: To install it, see [cURL Releases and Downloads][curl-download].

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When use the cURL command in Windows, use double-quotation marks instead of single-quotation marks for the option values.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When use the cURL command in Windows, use double-quotation marks instead of single-quotation marks for the option values.

trans-unit.source: For instructions about cluster provisioning, see [Get started using HDInsight][hdinsight-get-started] or [Provision HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-provision].
trans-unit.target: For instructions about cluster provisioning, see [Get started using HDInsight][hdinsight-get-started] or [Provision HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-provision].

trans-unit.source: You will need the following data to go through the tutorial:
trans-unit.target: You will need the following data to go through the tutorial:

trans-unit.source: The name of your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The name of your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Cluster user name specified at provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Cluster user name specified at provisioning.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Fill-in the values in the table.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Fill-in the values in the table.

trans-unit.source: This will be helpful for going through this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This will be helpful for going through this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: There are several ways to use Ambari to monitor HDInsight clusters.
trans-unit.target: There are several ways to use Ambari to monitor HDInsight clusters.

trans-unit.source: The following is an Azure PowerShell script to get the MapReduce job tracker information *in an HDInsight 3.1 cluster.* The key difference is that we pull these details from the YARN service (rather than MapReduce).
trans-unit.target: The following is an Azure PowerShell script to get the MapReduce job tracker information *in an HDInsight 3.1 cluster.* The key difference is that we pull these details from the YARN service (rather than MapReduce).

trans-unit.source: The following is an Azure PowerShell script for getting the MapReduce job tracker information *in an HDInsight 2.1 cluster*:
trans-unit.target: The following is an Azure PowerShell script for getting the MapReduce job tracker information *in an HDInsight 2.1 cluster*:

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of getting cluster information by using cURL:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of getting cluster information by using cURL:

trans-unit.source: When using the Ambari endpoint, "https://{clusterDns}.azurehdinsight.net/ambari/api/v1/clusters/{clusterDns}.azurehdinsight.net/services/{servicename}/components/{componentname}", the *host_name* field returns the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the node instead of the host name.
trans-unit.target: When using the Ambari endpoint, "https://{clusterDns}.azurehdinsight.net/ambari/api/v1/clusters/{clusterDns}.azurehdinsight.net/services/{servicename}/components/{componentname}", the *host_name* field returns the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the node instead of the host name.

trans-unit.source: Before the 10/8/2014 release, this example returned simply "**headnode0**".
trans-unit.target: Before the 10/8/2014 release, this example returned simply "**headnode0**".

trans-unit.source: After the 10/8/2014 release, you get the FQDN "**headnode0.{ClusterDNS}.azurehdinsight.net**", as shown in the previous example.
trans-unit.target: After the 10/8/2014 release, you get the FQDN "**headnode0.{ClusterDNS}.azurehdinsight.net**", as shown in the previous example.

trans-unit.source: This change was required to facilitate scenarios where multiple cluster types (such as HBase and Hadoop) can be deployed in one virtual network (VNET).
trans-unit.target: This change was required to facilitate scenarios where multiple cluster types (such as HBase and Hadoop) can be deployed in one virtual network (VNET).

trans-unit.source: This happens, for example, when using HBase as a back-end platform for Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: This happens, for example, when using HBase as a back-end platform for Hadoop.

trans-unit.target: For more information about the API, see [Ambari API Reference][ambari-api-reference].

trans-unit.source: Config types: core-site, hdfs-site, mapred-site, hive-site
trans-unit.target: Config types: core-site, hdfs-site, mapred-site, hive-site

trans-unit.target: Config types: core-site, hdfs-site, mapred-site, hive-site

trans-unit.source: Now you have learned how to use Ambari monitoring API calls.
trans-unit.target: Now you have learned how to use Ambari monitoring API calls.
